FILE NAME:     RSSQFT
DATE MODIFIED: November 4, 2024
USED BY:       RDSQFOOT subroutine of the National Energy Modeling System (NEMS) Residential Demand Module (RDM)
DEFINITION:    Average square feet of residential housing units for each of three housing types, nine census divisions, and projection years 2015-2050; data used to adjust heating, cooling, and lighting loads
UNITS:         Square feet of conditioned floorspace
DIMENSION:     projection year, housing type, U.S. Census division
SPECIAL CONSTRAINTS:  Data starts on row 21 of this file as per RDM convention.
ORGANIZATION OF DATA:
               Variables: SQRFOOT
               First 9 rows of data are single-family by census division 1-9; rows 10-18 are multifamily; rows 19-27 are mobile homes
SOURCES:       2020:  2020 RECS, the maximum of heated (TOTHSQFT) and cooled (TOTCSQFT) square footage (i.e., conditioned floorspace), weighted by U.S. census division and housing type
               2021-2023:  U.S. Census Bureau Survey of Construction data series, adjusted for conditioned floorspace, available online here:
                https://www.census.gov/construction/chars/completed.html -- squarefeet_cust.xls
                http://www.census.gov/construction/chars/mfu.html -- mfu_squarefeet_cust.xlsx
                https://www.census.gov/data/tables/time-series/econ/mhs/annual-data.html -- Annual_AvgSqft.xlsx
               2024 onward:  projected based on average of linear and logarithmic extrapolation of most recent 20-year (9-year for mobile home) historical values
COMMENT:       Revised to 2020 base year; updated single-family, multifamily, and mobile home historical completion (rather than sold) data through 2023; revised projected annual growth rates

2020	2021	2022	2023	2024	2025	2026	2027	2028	2029	2030	2031	2032	2033	2034	2035	2036	2037	2038	2039	2040	2041	2042	2043	2044	2045	2046	2047	2048	2049	2050
